sense.name: maintain or affirm that something is true
sense.examples: He claims that he cleaned his room. The Holy Cities claimed to have been built on seven hills. This candiate claims many supporters. Blanche constantly claims she is going to go off and see Shep.

sense.name: demand, ask for, or take as one's due
sense.commentary: NP1[+agent] CLAIM NP2 Insurance, tax, or other official claims: NP1[+agent] CLAIM
sense.examples: Cortez claimed the territory for the Queen. He claimed his suitcases at the airline counter. When my bike was stolen, I claimed on the insurance. He claimed on the maxium allowable tax credit.

sense.name: deserve, call for, or require
sense.examples: In some parts of the state, agriculture claims much attention. This issue claims no special rights.

sense.name: cause death, as if by right
sense.examples: The riots claimed thousands of lives. The bird flu claims more victims. It was a hurricane that claimed her life.
